sajjati.example_1: How does this one coalesce in the womb?”

sānu.sutta_1: tena kho pana samayena aññatarissā upāsikāya sānu nāma putto yakkhena gahito hoti.
sānu.example_1: Now at that time a certain lay woman had a son named Sānu who had been seized by a native spirit.
sānu.comment: son named Sānu who had been seized by a native spirit.

bhaddante.example_1: Hurry up, good luck to you!

nibhataṃ.example_1:
abhidhāvatha bhaddante,
kassa ujjhāpayāmase,
ādittā nīhataṃ [nibbhataṃ,
nibhataṃ] bhaṇḍaṃ,
puna ḍayhitumicchasīti.

jālini.example_1: there are no more abodes for me in the host of gods.

tosesi.sutta_1: atha kho piyaṅkaramātā yakkhinī puttakaṃ evaṃ tosesi:
tosesi.example_1: Then the native spirit Piyaṅkara’s Mother soothed her little child, saying:

sīvako.example_1: atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nagaramhā nikkhamantassa āloko antaradhāyi, andhakāro pāturahosi, bhayaṃ chambhitattaṃ lomahaṃso udapādi, tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi. atha kho sivako [sīvako] yakkho antarahito saddamanussāvesi –

cirāya.example_1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe. tena kho pana samayena aññataro upāsako cīrāya [cirāya] bhikkhuniyā cīvaraṃ adāsi. atha kho cīrāya bhikkhuniyā abhippasanno yakkho rājagahe rathikāya rathikaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ upasaṅkamitvā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi –

sussūsaṃ.example_1: having faith in the perfected ones,

pāpayāti.comment: pr pāpayati causes to reach; help to attain

ullokayataṃ.sutta_1: mamañhi vo dhajaggaṃ ullokayataṃ yaṃ bhavissati bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā lomahaṃso vā, so pahīyissati.
ullokayataṃ.example_1: Then your fear and terror will go away.

pabhijjeyyuṃ.comment: look at the context and commentary

ajjhāruhati.example_1: the simpleton will go after you even harder,

atthajātā.comment: born for a purpose; (comm) born for duties

sambhogā.example_1: thing of value for all living creatures.

aggadvārena.sutta_1: atha kho, bhikkhave, vepacitti asurindo paṭaliyo upāhanā ārohitvā khaggaṃ olaggetvā chattena dhāriyamānena aggadvārena assamaṃ pavisitvā te isayo sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme apabyāmato karitvā atikkami.
aggadvārena.example_1: Vepacitti put on his lined sandals, strapped on his sword, and, carrying a sunshade, entered the hermitage through the main gate. He walked right past those seers, keeping them at arm’s length.

anuvātaṃ.sutta_1: atha kho, bhikkhave, sakko devānamindo paṭaliyo upāhanā orohitvā khaggaṃ aññesaṃ datvā chattaṃ apanāmetvā dvāreneva assamaṃ pavisitvā te isayo sīlavante kalyāṇadhamme anuvātaṃ pañjaliko namassamāno aṭṭhāsi.
anuvātaṃ.example_1: Sakka took off his lined sandals, gave his sword to others, and, putting down his sunshade, entered the hermitage through the same gate. He stood downwind of those seers, revering them with joined palms.

ubbijjīti.sutta_1: atha kho, bhikkhave, sambaro asurindo tehi isīhi sīlavantehi kalyāṇadhammehi abhisapito rattiyā sudaṃ tikkhattuṃ ubbijjī”ti.
ubbijjīti.example_1: But after being cursed by the seers, Sambara woke in alarm three times that night.”

yassatthi.example_1: who has confidence in the Saṅgha,

atthamattanoti.example_1: out of regard for my own welfare.’”
